name: dusky meadow mosaic square
notes:
step into the quiet charm of dusky meadow, a mosaic crochet square that captures the gentle hush of twilight settling over a blooming field. 

at its heart, a stylized floral bud unfurls within a frame of crisp geometric lines—where nature’s softness meets structured serenity. this design invites you to explore contrast and calm, making it a perfect addition to seasonal blankets, sampler projects, or any piece that celebrates the beauty of dusk and the promise of bloom.

each square measures 19cm and you’ll need 2 shades of superfine/3ply yarn - less than 1 skein of each colour per square. if you use a different yarn to make your square, you might require different amounts and your completed square may vary in size.

inside the pattern you will find:

detailed written instructions (written in us terms)
special stitch explanations and diagrams
clear round-by round photos
easy to read chart
required tools

materials needed:

less than one cake of hobbii universe. the colourway seen in the photos is called “supercluster (05)” and any complementary contrasting colour of the same 3 ply/superfine weight
3mm / d3 hook
measuring tape for gauge
yarn needle
scissors
find more squares in this series here:

https://www.ravelry.com/designers/crochet-hooks-and-magic

this design is a premium pattern: a free version of this pattern is also available on my blog. the paid premium version offers a neat and beautifully formatted .pdf digital download that is ad-free and printer friendly and includes special stitch schematics, full written pattern, round-by-round photos and chart.
